alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Carteret; Craven; Jones; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 8:25PM EST until January 09 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jones County in eastern North Carolina... Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Southern Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... Pamlico County in eastern North Carolina... Central Carteret County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 915 PM EST. * At 825 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Vanceboro to near Cape Carteret, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... New Bern, Havelock, Morehead City, Cedar Island, James City, Trent Woods, River Bend, South River, North River, Davis, Straits, Sealevel, Marshallberg, Smyrna, Merrimon, Harlowe, Vanceboro, Askins, Lowland, and Cayton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Eastern North Carolina. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for eastern North Carolina.
